isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEMS DIAGNOSTICS - Circuit Diagnostics - Cylinder Balance

svcsubproc.title: Cylinder Balance Operation
svcsubproc.para: Many factors can influence the combustion process in a power cylinder and thereby affect the production of torque or horsepower from that cylinder. These factors include piston and cylinder geometry, injector performance, and rail pressure. Variations in any of these factors can lead to unevenness in torque and horsepower from one cylinder to the next. Power cylinder unevenness can result in increased engine noise and vibration, especially at low idle conditions. This is also referred to as rough idle.

The IDM utilizes a Cylinder Balance control strategy in an attempt to even the power contribution of the cylinders, particularly at low idle conditions. This strategy incorporates information from the crankshaft position system. The IDM uses the instantaneous engine speed near Top Dead Center (TDC) for each cylinder as an indication of that cylinder's power contribution. The IDM computes a nominal instantaneous engine speed value based on all cylinders. The nominal value would be the expected value from all cylinders if the engine is balanced. By knowing the error quantities, the IDM can add or subtract fuel from a particular cylinder. The control strategy attempts to correct the cylinder unbalance by using fuel quantity compensation through adjustments of the pulse width values for each fuel injector. This method of compensation is repeated until all error quantities are close to zero causing all cylinders to contribute the same amount.

While the engine is running, the IDM is constantly monitoring the crankshaft position system and can determine if the engine requires to be balanced. A DTC for Cylinder Balance will be set if the IDM is unable to balance the engine.
If a DTC for Cylinder Balance is set active, the IDM will turn off the Cylinder Balance strategy until the next key on cycle.
If a DTC for injector circuit is set active, the IDM will turn off the Cylinder Balance strategy. When the DTC changes to inactive the Cylinder Balance control will reset to on.
DTCs are read using the Electronic Service Tool (EST) or by counting the flashes from the amber and red ENGINE lamp.

item.para: DTC 571-578 is set by the ECM when the IDM is unable to adjust fuel quantity to compensate for rough idle.

svcsubproc.para: When DTCs are set for Cylinder Balance all Performance Diagnostics (section 6) should be performed.
